author: Staff Reporter
text:
A Madurai-based history-sheeter, V. Ranjith Kumar (33) alias Kattaiyan of Sellur, was murdered by a five-member gang in broad daylight on Malapatti Road near Abirami Nagar here on Monday.

When Ranjith was riding his two-wheeler at Abirami Nagar in the morning, the gang which came in a car intercepted and attacked him with lethal weapons. There were 17 deep cuts on the neck, stomach and back of Ranjith Kumar. He died on the spot.

Acting on information, Taluk police sent the body to Government Hospital here for post-mortem. The police said that several cases were pending against him at various police stations in the district. Five cases, including murder, intimidation and assault, were pending against him in Sellur police station in Madurai.

After he murdered one Muthukumar in Madurai in 2006, Ranjith shifted to Dindigul. To take revenge for Muthukumar’s murder, his brother ‘Mookurinji’ Ranjith might have murdered him, the police said.

Four special teams, led by Inspectors Murugan, Para Vasudevan, Kannan and Vairavan, had been formed to nab the assailants. The Deputy Superintendent of Police (Town station) would guide the teams, the police also added.
title: History-sheeter murdered
